snippet: At least 208 were reported killed, buildings collapsed and people fled into the streets after a 7.5 magnitude quake roiled sections of both countries.

byline.contributor: Mujib Mashal reported from Kabul, and Salman Masood from Islamabad, Pakistan. Reporting was contributed by Ismail Khan from Peshawar, Pakistan; Sana ul-Haq from Mingora, Pakistan; Waqar Gillani from Lahore, Pakistan; Naimatullah Karyab from Asadabad, Afghanistan; Jawad Sakhanyar from Kabul; Najim Rahim from Kunduz, Afghanistan; Khalid Alokozay from Jalalabad, Afghanistan; and Austin Ramzy from Hong Kong.
byline.original: By MUJIB MASHAL and SALMAN MASOOD

abstract: Magnitude 7.5 earthquake hits northern Afghanistan and Pakistan, compounding woe and complicating relief efforts in region already immiserated by poverty and warfare; current death toll of 208 is expected to rise substantially as communication systems return to functionality.
lead_paragraph: At least 208 were reported killed, buildings collapsed and people fled into the streets after a 7.5 magnitude quake roiled sections of both countries.

headline.print_headline: Quake Multiplies War’s Woes for Afghans and Pakistanis
headline.main: Earthquake Strikes Afghanistan and Pakistan, Multiplying War’s Woes
